sections.content: Introduction

Everybody is different. Every business is different. The various settings and features within the Customization category give us the tools to make Desk look, feel, and function in a way that works best for our customers.
Objectives

items: Showcase and demonstrate the various Customization options within Desk
Provide context to the use of some of these features, such as their uses within other modules

sections.content: Modules and Tabs
Customize which modules are available and how they're organized within your Desk portal.
Manage Modules
Control which modules are visible and active in your Desk portal. Enable or disable modules based on your support team's needs.
Organization vs Department Level Data Storage
Understanding the difference between organization-level and department-level data storage is crucial:

items: **Organization Level:** Data is shared across all departments (e.g., Contacts, Accounts)
**Department Level:** Data is isolated per department (e.g., Tickets are typically department-specific)
This structure affects visibility, reporting, and data access across your support organization

sections.content: Organize Tabs
Arrange the order of tabs in your navigation to match your team's workflow priorities.
Unselected Modules
Modules that aren't actively used can be hidden from view to reduce clutter and simplify navigation for your agents.
Rename Tabs
Customize tab names to match your organization's terminology and make the interface more intuitive for your team.
Layouts and Fields
Customize the data you collect and how it's presented through layouts and field configurations.
Layouts
Create multiple layouts for different use cases, departments, or ticket types. Each layout can have its own set of fields, sections, and organization.
**Use Case:** Create separate layouts for "Technical Support" vs "Billing Issues" to show only relevant fields for each ticket type.
Field Types
Zoho Desk supports various field types for capturing different kinds of data:
Nested Picklist
Create hierarchical dropdown menus where the options in one field depend on the selection in another field. Perfect for categorization systems like Product > Category > Sub-category.
Formula
Calculate values automatically based on other fields. Use formulas for calculations, concatenations, and conditional logic.
Lookup
Pull data from related modules. For example, automatically populate customer details from the Contacts module when a contact is selected on a ticket.
Field Permissions
Control which profiles can view, edit, or have read-only access to specific fields. This enables role-based data access at a granular level.
HIPAA and Encryption
For sensitive data, enable field-level encryption to protect confidential information. Essential for HIPAA compliance and handling personally identifiable information (PII).
**Important:** Encrypted fields cannot be used in certain features like search, reports, or workflow conditions. Plan your encryption strategy carefully.
Layout Rules
Show or hide fields dynamically based on user selections or field values. Layout rules help create dynamic, context-aware forms that adapt to the data being entered.
Validation Rules
Enforce data quality by setting rules that must be satisfied before a record can be saved. Validation rules prevent incorrect or incomplete data entry.
Field List
View and manage all custom fields across your modules in a centralized location. Track field usage and dependencies.
Field Dependencies
Create relationships between fields where the options in one field determine what's available in another. This is different from layout rules.

**Differences between Layout Rules and Field Dependencies:**

**Layout Rules:** Control field visibility (show/hide fields based on conditions)

**Field Dependencies:** Control field options (filter available choices based on another field's value)
Ticket Status
Customize the ticket lifecycle to match your support processes.
Status Type
Define custom ticket statuses beyond the default Open, On Hold, and Closed. Create statuses like "Pending Customer Response," "With Development Team," or "Waiting for Parts."
Fall-Back to Default
Configure what happens when a custom status is deleted or no longer available. Ensure tickets don't get stuck in invalid states.
General Settings
Various settings that control overall Desk behavior and functionality.
Tickets
Configure core ticket functionality:
Secondary Contacts (CCs) in Tickets
Enable CC functionality to keep additional stakeholders informed on ticket updates. All CC'd contacts receive email notifications about ticket activity.
Send as Email
Configure whether agents can send ticket responses as emails directly from the platform.
Ticket ID Configuration
Customize how ticket IDs are generated and displayed:

items: **Custom Prefix:** Add department or category identifiers (e.g., TECH-, BILLING-)
**Custom Suffix:** Add year, month, or other identifiers to ticket numbers

sections.content: **Example:** Configure ticket IDs as "SUPPORT-2025-00123" instead of the default numeric sequence.
Contacts
Settings related to contact management:
Automatic Spam Detection
Enable automatic spam detection to filter out unwanted tickets before they reach your agents. The system learns from tickets you manually mark as spam.
Agents
Agent-specific configuration:
Idle Timeout
Set how long agents can be inactive before they're marked as idle. This setting affects:

items: Automatic ticket assignment (idle agents may be skipped)
Agent availability status
Round-robin distribution rules
Workload management

sections.content: **Key Point:** Idle timeout plays into ticket assignment automations. Idle agents can be excluded from automatic assignment rules to ensure tickets go to available team members.
Notifications
Control how and when agents and customers are notified about ticket activity.
Notification Rules
Create custom notification rules to alert specific people when certain conditions are met. Configure notifications for ticket creation, updates, escalations, and more.
Feeds Preference
Customize what appears in your activity feeds and how notifications are displayed within the platform.
Skills
Skills allow you to tag agents with specific areas of expertise or certifications.
Skills tie into automations in several ways:

items: **Assignment Rules:** Route tickets to agents with specific skills (e.g., assign "Spanish Language" tickets to agents with Spanish language skills)
**Round Robin:** Include skill matching in round-robin distribution
**Escalation Rules:** Escalate to agents with advanced skill levels
**Workflow Conditions:** Trigger actions based on agent skills

sections.content: **Example:** Create skills like "Level 1 Support," "Level 2 Technical," "Billing Expert," or "Spanish Speaking" to enable intelligent ticket routing.
Training Activities
Have the trainees complete the following customization tasks:
Activity 1: Custom Layout and Fields

items: Navigate to **Setup > Customization > Layouts and Fields**
Select the Ticket module for one of your departments
Create a new custom layout (e.g., "Technical Support Layout")

Add at least 3 custom fields to this layout with different field types: One picklist field (e.g., "Issue Category"), One formula field (e.g., calculate days since ticket creation), One lookup field if applicable
Configure field permissions for at least one field
Create a layout rule that shows/hides a field based on another field's value
Save and assign the layout to a profile or department

sections.content: Activity 2: Ticket Template

items: Navigate to **Setup > Templates**
Create a new ticket template for the custom layout you created
Configure the template to pre-fill certain fields based on common ticket types
Test the template by creating a new ticket using it

sections.content:
**Step Beyond:** Create a Skill for use as criteria in certain automations. Check out some of the various automations and see where you might be able to utilize Skills. For example:

1. Create skills like "Database Expert" or "Network Specialist"
2. Assign these skills to agents
3. Create an assignment rule that routes tickets with specific keywords to agents with matching skills
Important Details Summary

items: **Modules and Tabs:** Manage modules, organize tabs, control visibility, rename for clarity
**Data Storage:** Understand organization-level vs department-level data isolation
**Layouts:** Create multiple layouts for different ticket types and departments
**Field Types:** Nested picklists, formulas, lookups for advanced data capture
**Field Permissions:** Control view/edit access at the field level
**HIPAA/Encryption:** Protect sensitive data with field-level encryption
**Layout Rules vs Field Dependencies:** Layout rules control visibility; field dependencies control available options
**Validation Rules:** Enforce data quality before records can be saved
**Custom Statuses:** Define ticket lifecycle stages specific to your process
**Ticket IDs:** Customize with prefixes and suffixes for better organization
**Idle Timeout:** Affects automatic ticket assignment and agent availability
**Skills:** Enable intelligent ticket routing based on agent expertise
**Notifications:** Customize when and how agents and customers are alerted

sections.content: Check Your Understanding
After completing this lesson, you should be able to:

items: Manage modules and organize tabs in Zoho Desk
Explain the difference between organization-level and department-level data storage
Create and configure custom layouts for different use cases
Add custom fields including nested picklists, formulas, and lookups
Configure field permissions for role-based access
Implement field-level encryption for sensitive data (HIPAA compliance)
Create layout rules to show/hide fields dynamically
Set up validation rules to enforce data quality
Understand the difference between layout rules and field dependencies
Create custom ticket statuses to match your support workflow
Configure ticket ID format with custom prefixes and suffixes
Enable and configure secondary contacts (CCs) on tickets
Set up automatic spam detection for contacts
Configure idle timeout and understand its impact on ticket assignment
Create and manage notification rules
Define agent skills and understand how they integrate with automations
Create ticket templates for consistent data entry
Use skills-based routing criteria in assignment rules
